authors: Khaleda Rahman For Daily Mail Australia
description: Nick van Vliet stumbled upon the vehicle as he went for a morning stroll with his wife and dog along Aldinga Beach in Adelaide on Thursday.
title: Adeliade woman's car gets smashed by surf
title_page: Adeliade woman's car gets smashed by surf | Daily Mail Online
text:
It’s definitely not the best start to the day.
A video captured a Toyota getting smashed by surf at Adelaide’s Aldinga Beach after the owner parked the vehicle and forgot about the tide coming in.
Nick van Vliet stumbled upon the vehicle as he went for a morning stroll with his wife and dog on Thursday.
The real estate agent saw the water crashing over the Toyota’s bonnet and filling it up and ran to check if someone was inside.
A video captured a Toyota getting smashed by surf at Adelaide’s Aldinga Beach after the owner parked the vehicle and forgot about the tide coming in
‘I was down at the beach with my wife and dog in the morning and we saw the car submerged in water so we went over to make sure no one was hurt,’ he told the Adelaide Advertiser.
Mr van Vliet said he’d noticed the vehicle, which has Northern Territory plates, in the area before with a woman sleeping inside.
‘The last time we saw her, she had parked very close to the water as well,’ he said.
‘She must park by the water and forget the tide is coming up.’
Nick van Vliet stumbled upon the vehicle as he went for a morning stroll with his wife and dog
Mr van Vliet posted the video on his Facebook page on Thursday, where it has been viewed more 120,000 times so far.
‘Not a good start for someone today,’ he captioned the clip.
‘Don't fall asleep in your car at the low tide mark. Aldinga Beach this morning.’
